div.p: This element belongs conceptually to WRITING PRODUCTION . It defines the selling price of a book, pamphlet, or other piece of writing. Encloses a number or sometimes a statement establishing meaning and context. May be used of original editions, reprints, or auction prices of unique copies or rare historical items. It has no mandatory sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <PPRICE>A coloured copy cost three shillings, an unpainted one a shilling.</PPRICE>
<PPRICE>In 2003 a copy of the first edition, not in its original binding, sold for Â£19,975.</PPRICE>

div.p: This element should where possible be used in conjunction with a TEXTSCOPE, so that we can attach the price to a particular text or set of texts.
